tweets.text: @PJGO56 @Bill_Esterson @EnvAgencyNW Hi Peter. Thanks for your interest. There is v clear data that shows the throttling affect that high Alt levels has on restricting discharge from the Dover‚Äôs Brook catchment. You‚Äôre quite right of course that it all ends up in the sea at Hightown.
The Trent ready to top it's floodbank at end of Littleborough Lane, Marton, this afternoon. @EnvAgency @LincsNaturalist https://t.co/arG24KQ8wb

@farmers_against @EnvAgency You're really showing your ignorance. The primary point here is one of increased flood conveyance and down stream flood risk NOT bank erosion (although this is likely a facor too). You should really be deleting this tweet especially considering you stand against 'misinformation'

@GoAndrCoop @Leesiddall @Go_CheshireWest @EnvAgencyNW ‚ÄòInterim report‚Äô for an event that happened in 2019. Why not the final report with recommended actions implemented? Usual council speed of operation i.e. too slow and too late. PS fashion advice.... drop the hat as you look like a prick.

@AWP_BackCountry @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @GeorgeMonbiot @CraigBennett3 Despite a lot of armchair experts stating this bank would wash away at the first sniff of rain, it does not seem to have been an accurate assumption.
@AWP_BackCountry @EnvAgency It was stated that the bank would ‚Äúlikely‚Äù wash away at the first rainfall. Is that an amazingLY stupid statement in the light of the recent weather?

Have we found a new way to fight floating pennywort on our rivers?
https://t.co/9EgETJk4jg @BritishCanoeing @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/YVuiow0ImV

tweets.text: Thanks to @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 for this video of River Alt at Lunt Meadows. 30 metres of embankment collapsed on Wednesday, saving Maghull from life threatening flooding. Big questions about whether to repair the breach or not as best way to protect against future flooding. https://t.co/noFY7D89n4
@clemserrell @worcscc @myworcester @EnvAgencyMids @worcester_uni @universityarena @firstworcester Use Henwick Road

üîä#StormCristoph Update üîä

We‚Äôve installed 2 #HVP‚Äôs at #Fishlake to pump water out of the Fishlake Woodhouse Washland.

Our mobile pumps + @OHDB_ pump station we‚Äôre moving 2.4 million of litres an hour of water back into the #RiverDon!

üôå Also great to meet the #FloodWardens üôå https://t.co/5Iho1nFBIm

Wow.... water storage at #Bickershaw during Storm Christoph 3ha of floods a metre deep on the flood plain @EnvAgency @WiganCouncil @Lancswildlife This is slow the flow at the landscape scale....... https://t.co/1rvzNsFt07

tweets.text: @farmers_against What an amazing stupid tweet. Its likely the increased conveyance & reduced attenuation of the flood discharge has increased flood peak & extent downstream! So no flood at this location but a bigger flood downstream! This is basic catchment hydrology. @EnvAgency #StormChristophe

tweets.text:
In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

Flow rate steadily climbing as the River Trent flood peak approaches #Newark. Levels forecast to peak tomorrow. Incredible amount of water, 517 tonnes every second! 
https://t.co/cVIZ0FMh7R @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/fLCYPHUh9w

In sadder news ..the @EnvAgency have started destruction of all hedges behind the flood bank. where we see whitethroats, Lesser Whitethroats, Linnets, just up from where the firecrest was. So called ‚Äòmitigation‚Äô is planned but you can‚Äôt replace this. So depressing. New Passage. https://t.co/QM3JTRA3iU

The #RiverTrent has spilled into the Victoria Embankment #Nottingham, a designated flood plain. 

The river & defences are operating as designed - the Nottingham Left Bank Scheme. 

Stay #FloodAware & check the latest #flood situation üëâ https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20

#StormChristoph https://t.co/O5R9xr5Zxc

tweets.text: @farmers_against @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @GeorgeMonbiot @CraigBennett3 This is dangerous and reckless misinformation about the dynamics of catchment and flood hydrology. It encourages poor land management practices and NATURA2000/SSSI destruction

We are operating Clifton Ings in York. The Ings are a temporary water storage area and are used to fill up with water to reduce the peak level downstream in York. They have a capacity of holding 2.3 million cubic metres of water. @CityofYork
@WorcsTravel @worcscc @myworcester @EnvAgencyMids @worcester_uni @universityarena @firstworcester Hello, could you confirm which will be open around 2.30am- I‚Äôm a baker and need to get to work

tweets.text: Still some flooded roads in #Dallam but water levels receding today allowing homeowners back to start the clear up.  Speaking to @EnvAgencyNW  and @pow_rebecca to ensure the scenes we‚Äôve witnessed over last 72 hours don‚Äôt return. #Warrington #StormChristoph https://t.co/0A0HlMYuPL
View of the road to Shelsley Beauchamp from New Mill bridge on the left. River Teme is between the 2 rows of trees on the bottom left?? https://t.co/khVcZ4udOl

Staff have been at Bubwith today using temporary pumps and Sandbags to reduce the risk of flooding to properties in the village due to high levels in the Derwent. Thanks to @ERfloodrisk and @EnvAgencyYNE for  their assistance with sourcing Sandbags. https://t.co/7PPnCQkd4c
Quick update: @EnvAgencyNW was very fast to respond to our concerns and have already been on site to develop a plan for the river bank repair. Very efficient considering they are so busy. üòÅ

Residents of Fishlake may have noticed @EnvAgencyYNE  pumps in the area.

They will be in operation from tonight to assist with the drawdown of the washlands standing water. https://t.co/uaKgTAGYyV

tweets.text: Stunning walk this morning along the Rib Valley until I came across this. Left wondering if the news today on @Dunne4Ludlow ‚Äòs PMB and @EnvAgency response will make any difference and on what timescale for this rare chalk stream https://t.co/IPolBoStUW

The river Lugg at kingsland is running nicely this morning, unlike other waterways which are flooding all over Herefordshire. When will it be decided if these works helped or hindered? https://t.co/j8lCilYVb7
We'll have an update from Dave Brown from @EnvAgency later this evening - he essentially recognised that more work needs to be done to stop the surface water issue being so damaging next time

Hard to believe this shows the top of the wooden pagoda walk and maze area in Rowntree Park üòÆ The water must be 7' deep üò¨

#StormChristoph #rowntreepark
#floods #york @Fr_RowntreePark
#flooding @EnvAgencyYNE @yorkpress https://t.co/Rv1aHwsbVL
‚ö†Ô∏è Hylton Road #Worcester will be closing around 7pm for the closure of the flood gate - at the same time A44 Bull Ring, St John's will reopen westbound up to Henwick Road https://t.co/LGJULU7vK2

@lisegirl1 @EnvAgency Heartbreaking. To make things worse the footpath will be closed for months as well.  There will be loss if some of the wetland as well, I suspect there will be fewer breeding waders with disturbance throughout the breeding season. Shame on @EnvAgency

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency‚Äôs flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here‚Äôs a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk
@jonangell @EnvAgency https://t.co/mbNuog4Ddg

tweets.text: @Bill_Esterson @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 IMO the breach of the embankment did not save Maghull. It was the designed operation of the spillway to take excess river water into the flood resevoir lagoons. The water now in Lunt would have flowed to or been pumped out to sea  had the embankment not failed.
I just can‚Äôt get over the fact the government threw manufacturing and services under the bus to save the fishing industry and three weeks later it‚Äòs collapsing
Now this is a lovely message to end the week @EnvAgencyAnglia  #geographyteacher #flooding ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/Xa5pXvKsIC

tweets.text: The #flood map reflects the huge amount of water coming down the #Severn following #StormChristoph. It‚Äôs more important now than ever to be #floodaware üëâ https://t.co/NRflvZ9HD2 https://t.co/3JNBMlWkFa

@Leesiddall @Go_CheshireWest @EnvAgencyNW No. The interim report has been published, which includes actions for CW&C and partners. Many elements are vastly improved on 2019 and a small fortune has been spent on drainage investigation work. Lots of people are working hard on this. Find out the facts before criticising.
Updated flood warning for #Malton #Norton from @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/q2cZfYj383

Meanwhile 20mm of rain over south #herefordshire has caused this.

#soilpatrol has been out today and this farmer will be receiving a visit. https://t.co/abaUme57we
@AllanChard @EnvAgency Yeh Al. We fought really hard too but it‚Äôs all about big business.
@lisegirl1 @EnvAgency Where can I find out why?  Is it on @EnvAgency website?
#Bewdley #Severn high flows, barrier doing its job @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency https://t.co/wsh0I5Bwdy
